Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, lovely clean and secure hotel all at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: KelleyaScott
Reviews.Content: Rooms have sound proof walls however it's not your neighbours you need to worry about - its the noisy street - the windows are NOT sound proof. Service was amazing, breakfast was simple and a little pricey, location was fab and if only the Irish pub wasnt next door it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peegs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, near to all the pubs and eateries. No problem finding a place for dinner at night. The lady at the receiption when we checked in, forgot to ask for her name, but we knew she stayed in the US before and spoke perfect English. She was very friendly and helpful, even helped with our heavy luggage! Such a strong girl! We met 2 different guys at the reception on other days and all have been friendly and helpful, so we were really thankful (esp. after reading from some of the reveiws here about the unfriendly reception). We stayed at the junior suite, spacious enough for 3 of us. Only wished they would fix more lights as the room is rather dark. Room had a small kitchenette, but the hob wasn't working. The lady at the reception was very kind to arrange for a kettle for us since all we needed was to boil water. Overall, stay was very pleasant. Word of warning - elevator is very tight, and had to go up a few narrow steps before reaching it, so quite a feat with heavy luggage. Their sister hotel just across, Hotel Villa d'Estrees where the reception was, perhaps might be better, as we noticed the elevator is on the same level.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: wccDelmar
Reviews.Content: we stayed for eight days in early january, this was our fifth trip to paris. the price was right at 200 euro but the 350 e standard rate would be a deal breaker. stayed in a junior suite. rooms dark, especially the bedroom. small galley kitchenette was adequate. the rooms are worn and could use an update. the pub across the street is a lively place. only noise was on friday and saturday night. it was january for us but my gut tells me (along with other reviews) that in the warmer weather the noise might be unbearable. the elevator is a double wide coffin! the location can't be beat. had little contact with the hotel staff except for the housekeeper and he couldn't have been nicer. hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place but...”
Reviews.Author: hugheysaltlake
Reviews.Content: I needed a larger room in paris to accomodate my daughter and this place has a lovely suite (61) for that. The elevator is very narrow and this room is on the top floor- if you are overweight, not a good choice. The room is lovely, bathroom new and redone. Only issue (aside from breaking my arm but not their fault) is the loud bar across the street that didn't help the first night time change.Great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Service Poor, Room Okay”
Reviews.Author: stacytuned
Reviews.Content: The location is great the front desk staff, poor attitude, lazy, rude and very unhelpful. There is noise from pub below as drunken folk spill out when they close and start yelling and singing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jsweat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is beautiful, staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is spectacular. The neighborhood is full of great cafes and bistros, and it is an easy walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn`t recommend it at all!”
Reviews.Author: val f
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The price is really high, they give you nothing, there is no service at all, only one single person, that does everything (check in ant check out, she can´t do much more), the rooms are tiny, the bathroom is horrible, although it is located in the heart of the latin quarter, at night you cannot sleep for the noises outside (and I stayed a tuesday and wensday, on weekends the noise is far worse), it seems that walls and windows are made out of paper, and when you complain, she answers that you should wear ear pulgs! a hotel souldn´t be like this! I`d rather have another location and take a taxi if you want to go to the latin quarter...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hanna24NSWAustralia
Reviews.Content: Choosing an Hotel in Paris is not easy as there are so many to pick from, so we started by looking at the area that would suit as best and then used Tripadvisor to sort through the dozens available. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. very well positioned, good sized room by Paris standards and very well appointed. The staff were very helpful at all times and the room was very clean and the bed comfortable. There are dozens of great eating places close by and easy walking to many of the major attractions such as Notre Dame + The Louvre (which by the way is not open on a Tuesday, the only day we had free to see it!) There is an Irish theme pub right opposite that we were a bit worried about in regard to noise but we ahd no trouble at all in fact we did not ven notice it from our room. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, friendly staff and great accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: JuliePollard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for seeing all the sights of Rome. 5 minutes from the Notre Dame, plenty of great restaurants close by, as well as shopping, transport. Our junior suite gave us plenty of room to relax and the pub downstairs was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, perfect location! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Melttu84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I just got back from a girls trip to Paris where we stayed in the Residence Des Arts. We all absolutely loved this place. The location is perfect! Extremely safe, right next to the Metro, and steps away from all of the cutest clothing boutiques, Notre Dame and the Louvre. We stayed in a junior suite room that had plenty of room for 4 girls and their tons of bags. The main thing that made our stay so wonderful was the staff. The young women working the front desk were among the nicest and most helpful that I have come into contact with. I cannot say enough about how friendly they were and how willing they were to sit with us and walk us through our days in Paris. I will definitely be staying here again next time I come to Paris. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: htrin3_family
Reviews.Content: I spent with my husband and fourteen years old son, 9 nights at the fifth floor junior suite of this hotel. At first, I was very concerned about some bad reviews on its cleanness. Fortunately that was not the case: the hotel is very clean. The small staff was very attentive and let us check in early. This was a bless since we arrived very early and were really tired due to a terrible Air France flight. The room was spacious, with a huge double bed, a very comfortable sofa bed, lots of space for the luggage and clothes, a safe, flat tv a desk and a small kitchenette. We slept incredibly well with our windows closed and AC on. The bathroom was very spacious too and the shower was great. At first, the WIFI was not functioning but they called a company to adjust it. The hotel region is the best: Saint Michel. It is lively, safe and very beautiful. Few blocks from the Seine banks, metro stations, many attractions, restaurants, cafes and boutiques. There's no doubt about returning to this same hotel in our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aussies2225
Reviews.Content: We had been warned that accommodation in Paris was very small and travelling with a family of 4 we thought we were going to be in a shoebox but were surprised to find our room was a suite with a separate lounge, kitchenette and a very large bathroom. The hotel had a very small lift in it. We did not use any of the hotel services apart from the free WiFi. The hotel is located in a very lively part of Paris, near the Notre Dame, with lots of restaurants and shops, a supermarket and laundromat nearby. With the kitchenette we could grab food and take it back to our room, which was great as Paris is quite expensive. Although the streets below still had plenty of activity until late in the night, once the windows were close the room was very quite. Because we were located so close to the River Seine, we bought a weekly pass on the Batobus - the river taxi - which was great to get around on. A little slow but you got to see the sites of Paris from the river. The metro station was also very close.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for getting around Paris”
Reviews.Author: peacefulhols
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel v. close to restaurants & getting to main attractions. We had 2 adjoining apartments on the 5th floor on a room only basis - if you are claustrophobic you won't like the tiny lift but we were happy to walk up & down as we only used the apartments as a crash pad. The only negative would be that I couldn't see any sign of a fire exit. The staff were very helpful. If you wanted to cook there was a tiny kitchen but all we made were cups of tea! You could also pay for breakfast at the hotel. The bed was very clean and comfortable and there was aircon. One room was a double & the other was for 4 people and had loads of space.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JL26Montr_al
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the second time, after a long research we found the residence des arts, located in my favourite area in Paris: the latin quarter.The rooms are very big for Paris, we booked a Junior suite, confortable bed, trendy wall paper, small living room and a large bathroom. The suite is perfect when you travel with kids, they had the livingroom and we stayed in the bedroom. You have to try the bar downstairs, the cafe latin, good food, good service and a classic french bistrot.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FREDO27
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris in August, one of the best to visit Paris, nice weather, not to much tourist. We stayed at the Residence des arts and we had a great stay, we reserved a Junior Suite, rooms are nicely decorated and very big. You have a nice living room and a large bed, very confortable. don't need to take the metro, everything is walking distance. Best hotel value, I had so far in Paris and very romantic for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,but really dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariu40
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five days in Paris along with my husband and two kids. The location was good, very convenient, close to restaurants and attractions,quite noisy also. But the rooms were unbearably dirty!! We got sick instantly the same day, Ac units were clogged with dust, the rugs were full of dust and under the bed we found kids shoes, books,condoms, you name it!!. It's not that I go looking under hotel beds, but I wonder what was making us so sick with allergies, until I look under the bed and behind the sofa bed in which my son was sleeping I realise that they never clean properly, they have very low standard in terms of clealiness. They also offered free internet, but the signal was terrible, we had to put our laptop on the balcony and that way we got very low reception.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here- bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Natalie150
Reviews.Content: This was out second visit to this hotel, the first time we stayed across the street at Villa d'Estree and it was fine. The Residence des Arts, across the street, is actually small apartments, no lobby, very small elevator and a foul odor in the room. However, we were not disturbed by all this and enjoyed the great location and accessibility. Even the Irish Pub on the street level where partying goes on until 5 a.m. on the weekends was fine. The worst part was after a week stay we returned home to the US and immediately noticed small welts which we first thought were mosquito bites, but after a few days when they spread the neck and arms, they were diagnosed as bed bugs. We have notified the hotel, so becareful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tillsy8292
Reviews.Content: Hotel Residence des Arts was a great little hotel. Minutes walk from major landmarks in Paris and the metro station, the hotel is in a perfect location, in the 'snazzy' latin quarter of Paris. Although, we had concerns after reading some of the reviews on this site, the hotel did not disappoint in any way. We stayed in the Junior Suite, which is quite large and comfortable (especially by Paris and European standards). The room is clean and well kept, and was lovley to come home to after a long day exploring Paris. The Staff were extremely helpful, and were able to speak quite good English, as well as putting up with our bad attempts at French. The hotels breakfast is 12 euros, but we never opted for this, instead having breakfast at nearby cafes or buying our own bread etc. The next time we come to Paris, we will definitely be staying at the Hotel residence des arts again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Res2nVA
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Perfect location. 2 min walk to Metro station. 5 min walk to Notre Dame. We stayed at the Junior Suite which is perfect for a family of 4. Spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon with a weird ending!”
Reviews.Author: mearish
Reviews.Content: So we arrived for our honeymoon which was a week long. The hotel staff was very helpful but we ran in to quite a few problems. The manager came off as being extremely rude but the front desk staff were very helpful. It seemed odd when we had to ask for the essentials like toilet paper in a hotel. They offered a breakfast for 12 Euros each per day that consisted of juice and bread. We opted not to do this. There was an odd smell in the hotel hallways that I just cannot put my finger on. The room was fairly clean and large so it was a good place to crash after a long day in Paris. My general thought was to not reccomend this hotel to anyone due to the above problems. In regards to the weird ending, we were packing to leave so we went to check out across the street at the main hotel and were escorted by the management of the property since there was police tape surrounding the entire block of Git Le Cour where this hotel is. So we had to walk under police tape to get to the metro station. We are not sure what happened but there were an awful lot of police and what looked to be a coroner van waiting. We were very thankful that we didn't see this until our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Residence des Arts”
Reviews.Author: garciarsm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the Paris Latin Quarter. It is walking distance from the River Seine, Notre Dame, the Louvre and the D'orsay museums. The underground is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable although the shower in our studio room was a bit small. The staff was friendly, courteous and available to help. The hotel is surrounded by exciting night life so if peace and quiet is a priority, consider a different hotel. I would certainly stay at Hotel Residence des Arts again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated”
Reviews.Author: zevbn
Reviews.Content: We got a room called Delux: a very small room, where the bed takes most of it. The bathroom door is so close to the bed, you can hear any activity there! Furthermore, bathroom door cannot be closed. Breakfast is given across the street, in a 4* hotel owned by the same proprieter: stingy and poor choice, no bufet. For the price demanded one can do much better in the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Femmedumonde
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are much larger than average in Europe overall. It was like an upgraded Embassy Suites. The desk was helpful and the location is what made it great. Within 5 minutes walking in any direction you will find tons of restaurants. Now, I did have an issue with the shower door, but it was nothing. Also, the hotel has free wireless, which is a plus, since the other 4 hotels we have stayed all charged at least 15 euros. I would recommend this hotel for those that want a great room, good location and price. It is near the RER and the Metro station Saint Michel. This may not mean much now, but it is really important once you get here.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable choice for a few days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WendyannR
Reviews.Content: Accomodation was perfect for us (a couple in our fifties)-2 room suite on 6th floor - huge comfortable bed, nice, separate sitting room and spacious bathroom. The kitchen corner with fridge and microwave was adequate for breakfast and snacks which suited us fine, but would be hopeless if you wanted to cook meals. The lift was even smaller than other reviews led us to expect, but again was fine if you are able bodied. The pub was indeed noisy on Saturday night especially, but I used earplugs and my husband slept though it, so it wasn't a major problem. Otherwise, the accomodation was remarkably quiet. St Germain is the best place to stay in Paris for restaurants and for many of the sights, and this was good value for the accomodation and location - 245 euros per night. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great service”
Reviews.Author: mcleane
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, especially if you want to feel like you're right in the middle of Paris. Great location, steps from everything on a very charming street in the Latin quarter. A block away from the Place St. Michel, a very good restaurant two doors down, other restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance, and an internet cafe on the same street. This is not a large 4 star American style hotel, but much more intimate. We had a suite with a king bed and sitting room connected to a room with twin beds. Both were very nice, small by American standards but fully equipped and very comfortable. The staff, particularly Francoise and Letitia, were very accomodating both before and during our stay - arranging to rent a wheelchair for us, get good seats at the theater, call each morning for a taxi, etc. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, but there are some issues!”
Reviews.Author: b416
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the most picture-postcard perfect area of Paris, seconds from the St. Michel Fountain and the St.Michel/Notre-Dame Metro & RER stops. There are many one-lane narrow roads, cafes, stores, and other shops that you would typically expect to see in Paris. The hotel itself is cute, even has been retro-fitted with a tiny, unique elevator that is probably half the size of your closet. I stayed in a mini-apartment which was tastefully decorated. However at almost 300 Euros per night, the kitchenette and bathroom could use some major improvements. The bathroom particularily felt very dirty. The tile grout was not clean, and missing in some places. The shower stall had a broken shampoo/soap shelf. Add to that, the shower stall accumulates water and doesn't drain properly, so you're standing in a pool of water. Add to that, the "high-speed Internet" wasn't working when I arrived. While the receptionist at the hotel was more than accomodating by paying for me to use the Internet at the cafe next door, at these prices, I felt it should have been working. This hotel wasn't a horrible experience, but, at these prices, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms, some problems”
Reviews.Author: JerDok
Reviews.Content: Room is Big! We stayed in a suite with two babies. Small Bedroom but big living room with sofa, dining table, lots of furniture. Old carpet was covered with a better one. Big nice and clean bathroom with bath and shower. We had asked for 2 baby cribs and were provided with them upon our arrival at the hotel. However, as they were portable, the one was broken and could not be used. We had to keep one baby on the double bed for our full stay. The other one was just dirty. Outside of the room's door if you do not have any expectations, you will not get disapointed. Elevator stops at the mid-floors and with 2 babies it was an adventure to get to the elevator that is abt half meter wide, smallest I've ever seen. Upon check out after 3 days, the lady at the reception apologized for the baby bed in a rather rude way. The location of the hotel is excellent and as soon as you step out you are surrounded of nice cafes and restaurants. Great location. Many more hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: electricplum
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the one of the suites that sleeps 3-4 people. It was the perfect size for 2 adults and 2 children. When we checked in there was no record of the baby cot (crib) we had requested but one was provided very quickly for us. The staff spoke great English and were very helpful. The room was very tastefully decorated and had everything we needed, including a seperate shower and bath. The location is excellent - literaly 2 min walk to the Metro, 5 mins to Notre Dame, 10mins to the Louvre. So many restuarants within a 10 min walk it was hard to know where to start. The pub was a little noisy on Sat night but it didn't keep us awake. We had a great time and would highly recommend this hotel. Oh, the elevator is the smallest I have ever seen - it couldn't even fit our small collapsible stroller in it, unless it was collapsed. Tiny ! But otherwise everything was great !

Reviews.Title: “Don't pat the extra 7 EUR for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: trinity7688
Reviews.Content: Just spent my birthday in Paris and had a wonderful time as it was dry all week and not too cold for January. Hotel des Arts in a convenient location, nearest metro stops are Abesses and Pigalle, within walking distance of Sacre Coeur and lots of local bars/restaurants. My only negative comment would be the poor breakfast which you have to pay an extra 7 EUR per person, it's all cold stuff with jams etc. Do not pay for this as there are lots of boulangeries a walk down the hill and there's a Broiche D'Or down the hill next to the Pigalle metro where you can eat a set breakfast eg. hot drink, hot baguette & sweet pastry sitting in. Also, more value for money is going up L'Arc du Triomphe - 360 view and La Defense - wonderful glass elevator and large shopping centre too, not Eiffel Tower.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residence des Arts
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Rue Git Le Coeur | Latin Quarter, 75006 Paris, France
